trans-unit.source: Serves as the base class for the different column types of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
The DataGridColumn class is the base class for all column types of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
It defines the properties and methods that are common to all column types.
An instance of the DataGridColumn class is not created directly.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
> [!NOTE] > Instances of this class are typically not created directly.
It is a base class that defines the properties and methods common to all column type classes.
Gets a value that indicates whether the column is in design mode.
Use the DesignMode property to programmatically determine whether the column is in design mode.
For more information about design mode, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite.DesignMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the column is in design mode; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the style properties for the footer section of the column.
Use this property to provide a custom style for the footer section of the column.
Common style attributes that can be adjusted include foreground color, background color, font, and content alignment within the cell.
Providing a different style enhances the appearance of the column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains the style properties for the footer section of the column.
The default value is an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref>.
Gets or sets the text displayed in the footer section of the column.
Use the FooterText property to specify or determine the text displayed in the footer section of the column.
> [!CAUTION] > Text is not HTML-encoded before it is displayed in the footer section of the column.
This makes it possible to embed script within HTML tags in the text.
If this property is set dynamically using user input, be sure to validate the value to reduce security vulnerabilities.
The text displayed in the footer section of the column.
The default value is <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Gets or sets the location of an image to display in the header section of the column.
Use the HeaderImageUrl property to specify the URL of an image to display in the header section of the column.
You can use a relative or an absolute URL.
A relative URL relates the location of the image to the location of the Web page without specifying a complete path on the server.
The path is relative to the location of the Web page.
This makes it easier to move the entire site to another directory on the server without updating the path to the image in code.
An absolute URL provides the complete path, so moving the site to another directory requires updating the code.

> [!NOTE] > If you want to display text instead of an image in the header section of the column, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderText%2A> property instead of this property.
The location of an image to display in the header section of the column.
The default value is <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Gets the style properties for the header section of the column.
Use this property to provide a custom style for the header section of the column.
Common style attributes that can be adjusted include foreground color, background color, font, and content alignment within the cell.
Providing a different style enhances the appearance of the column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains the style properties for the header section of the column.
The default value is an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref>.
Gets or sets the text displayed in the header section of the column.
Use the HeaderText property to specify or determine the text displayed in the header section of the column.
If you want to display an image instead of text in the header section of the column, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property instead of this property.
> [!CAUTION] > Text is not HTML-encoded before it is displayed in the header section of the column.
This makes it possible to embed script within HTML tags in the text.
If this property is set dynamically using user input, be sure to validate the value to reduce security vulnerabilities.
The text displayed in the header section of the column.
The default value is <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Provides the base implementation to reset a column derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> class to its initial state.
The Initialize method provides the base implementation to reset a column derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class to its initial state.
This method is not called directly.
Instead, this method is inherited by a derived column class, which can then be used to reset a column of the derived type.
You can optionally override this method in the derived class to provide a custom initialization routine.

This base implementation of the Initialize method is often called from the overridden method to reset properties common to all column types derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
The Initialize method is usually called during data binding, prior to the first row being bound.
When the Initialize method is used, the design mode of the column is set to `true`.
> [!NOTE] > This method is commonly used by control developers.
Provides the base implementation to reset the specified cell from a column derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> class to its initial state.
The InitializeCell method provides the base implementation to reset the specified cell from a column derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class to its initial state.
This method is not called directly.
Instead, this method is inherited by a derived column class, which can then be used to reset a cell in the column of the derived type.
You can optionally override this method in the derived class to provide a custom initialization routine.

This base implementation of the InitializeCell method is often called from the overridden method to reset properties common to all cells in columns derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
In this implementation, the InitializeCell method resets only the header and footer cells.
Other types of cells are not affected by this method.

When sorting is enabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowSorting%2A> property to `true`), a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is added to the header cell by default.
This allows you to sort the column when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control is clicked.

If you specify an image for the header cell (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property), an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ImageButton> control is created instead.
When sorting is disabled, the text specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderText%2A> property is displayed in the header cell.

If you specify an image for the header cell (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderImageUrl%2A> property), an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image> control is added to the header cell.

Because a browser will not display an empty cell, if an image in not displayed in the header cell and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.HeaderText%2A> property is not set, a nonbreaking space HTML entity (` `) is displayed in the header cell.

Similarly, if the footer cell does not have any content (if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.FooterText%2A> property is not set), a nonbreaking space HTML entity is displayed in the footer cell.
> [!NOTE] > This method is commonly used by control developers.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell"></xref> that represents the cell to reset.
The column number where the cell is located.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType"></xref> values.
Gets a value that determines whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> object is marked to save its state.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> is marked; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the style properties for the item cells of the column.
Use this property to provide a custom style for the item cells of the column.
Common style attributes that can be adjusted include foreground color, background color, font, and content alignment within the cell.
Providing a different style enhances the appearance of the column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref> that contains the style properties for the item cells of the column.
The default value is an empty <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableItemStyle"></xref>.
Loads the state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> object.
This method is used primarily by the .NET Framework infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
However, control developers can override this method to specify how a custom server control restores its view state.
For more information, see [ASP.NET State Management Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Use the LoadViewState method to load the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> object.
This allows a column to perform custom view-state management.
An <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>.
Calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.OnColumnsChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

When the properties of a column derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class change, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataGridDesigner.OnColumnsChanged%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method should be called.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control that the column is a member of.
Use the Owner property to programmatically determine the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control that the column is a member of.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control that the column is a member of.
Saves the current state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> object.
Use the SaveViewState method to save the state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> object.
This allows a column to perform custom view-state management.
An <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that contains the saved state of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the field or expression to pass to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.OnSortCommand*> method when a column is selected for sorting.
Use the SortExpression property to specify or determine the name of the field to pass to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.OnSortCommand%2A> method when a column is selected for sorting.
> [!NOTE] > This property does not bind the column to a field in data source.
To bind a column to a field, see the documentation for the specific column type.
When sorting is enabled, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> controls are rendered in the heading section of each column where the SortExpression property is set.

> [!NOTE] > When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property is set to `true`, the SortExpression property for each column in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control that supports data binding is automatically set with the field name bound to the column.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AutoGenerateColumns%2A> property is set to `false`, you need to manually set the SortExpression property with the field name bound to the column for each column that you want to enable sorting for.
These <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> controls allow you to sort the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control by the selected column.
When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LinkButton> control for a column is clicked, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.SortCommand> event is raised.

The value of the SortExpression property for the selected column is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.OnSortCommand%2A> event handler as part of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridSortCommandEventArgs> object.
The name of the field to pass to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.OnSortCommand*> when a column is selected for sorting.
The default value is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the column is tracking view state changes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn.IsTrackingViewState%2A> member is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom implementation from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> object is tracking its view-state changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads previously saved state.
An <xref:System.Object> that represents the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> object to restore.
Returns an object containing state changes.
The <xref:System.Object> that contains the view state changes.
Starts tracking state changes.
Returns the string representation of the column.
Use the ToString method to get the string representation of the column.
> [!NOTE] > This method is inherited from the <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> class and is not applicable to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class.
Returns <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName>.
Causes tracking of view-state changes to the server control so they can be stored in the server control's <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object.
Use the TrackViewState method to track view-state changes on the server control so they can be stored in the server control's <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag?displayProperty=fullName> object.
This allows a column to perform custom view-state management.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object that allows a column derived from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref> class to store its properties.

Use the ViewState property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag?displayProperty=fullName> object that allows a column derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn> class to store its properties.
The state of each property is automatically managed.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumn"></xref>.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the column is visible in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control.
Use the Visible property to programmatically control whether the column is visible in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the column is visible in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid"></xref> control; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
